website_summaries.verdict: UglyStik is well-known for their sturdily constructed and affordable spinning rods, and between their longevity and sensitivity, these rods are well-worth its already low price.
pros: Available in a wide range of sizes
cons: This model isn’t quite as flexible as some other spinning rods

website_summaries.verdict: The strongest and most responsive rod that's also good for long fishing days.
pros: Tough yet lightweight construction (graphite and fiberglass)
Its unique Clear Tip design makes it very sturdy and responsive
Cork handles reduce pressure on hands.Guides prevent insert pop-outs
cons: Some find the rod to be a bit uncomfortable

customer_reviews.title: not designed for braided line.
customer_reviews.text: Rod is durable except for the tip eye if you are using a braided line. I do a fair amount of fishing and within a month the front eye has grooves notched in it from 10 lb braided line. The notches create a very abrasive surface and destroys line at a furious pace.
customer_reviews.author: dogdexter1

customer_reviews.title: This Ugly stick is absolutely amazing. I have caught trout from less than a ...
customer_reviews.text: This Ugly stick is absolutely amazing. I have caught trout from less than a pound to 28 pound salmon to European Cats weighting almost 100 pounds on this rod in 18 countries and it has never failed me. I have convinced everyone I have fished with and alongside on tis rod! This will always be my rod of choice...
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good rod but showed up damaged. Scratched up and eyes were bent. The way they packaged it was crap. Update: very durable rod. Have caught a number of nice sized fish to include Jack's, Snapper & Sharks. This rod handles them all with ease and hasn't even come close to breaking.
customer_reviews.author: dunny

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cork handle
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful cork handle, reel seat etc. Seems to be very well constructed. Disappointed in the weight. Heavy, middle and front heavy. I'm not an ugly stik fan, generally I like rods with much more graphite content. I do have a regular ugly stik of the same length and weight. This rod is just as heavy and not as balanced. It does hava a stiffer spine, so one would think it has more graphite. Sorry, it is just not better than a regular ugly stik. Buy a Berkley Lightning rod for less money. It is simply a. much better rod.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible !
customer_reviews.text: I have had uglystixs my whole life, you can always depend on them. I also have graphite rods and they break or they have the potential to break , I have broken the tips of the graphite rods, the uglystixs are my favorite go to rod I have them in many different sizes. I once slammed my car trunk down on the uglystixs it was the tip of the rod that got most of the car trunk by accident and guess what happened,( absolutely nothing ) you can't break these rods. You don't have to baby these rods like you do graphite rods you can throw them around and not worry about them
customer_reviews.author: Corvuscorax

customer_reviews.title: My go to rod.
customer_reviews.text: It's an UGLY STIK. Nothing more needs to be said. I snagged a shark that was at least 5ft long and although I ended up losing it(never wanted it to take my bait in the first place), this bad boy held on like a champ. My 30lb braid ended up snapping after about 30 seconds because the rod wouldn't budge. I love the sensitivity and strength of this rod. I'm new to "matching" my rod and reel, however, I spoke with a guide at his bait shop who stated he only uses ugly stik on his charters because they hold up and costs a fraction of the price. I paired mine with the Penn Battle II 3000 reel. Great combo.
customer_reviews.author: rizzaman12

customer_reviews.title: Pole was bent.  Made in China.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a huge Ugly Stik fan for 35+ years. I currently have about 15 Ugly Stik fishing poles. Just received this one in the mail and the pole is crooked. Never seen that before in a fishing pole. Checked and it was made in China. I returned this one and decided to buy my first top of the line pole instead. Wow, what a difference. Ugly Stiks are good for the casual fisherman or kids that are hard on gear. If you are an avid fisherman I would save up and buy a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: I believe better products are available for less money
customer_reviews.text: Tip section isn't straight. Ferrule is loose. Quality control is just absent. I don't expect a fancy rod for 50.00. I do expect one without defects that is usable. Shakespeare used to produce such a product. I believe better products are available for less money. This one's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Tip of fishing rod
customer_reviews.text: I've requested replacement but as this Ugly Stik arrived 3 days ago, the tip of the rod is broken, but likely missing as I could not find the piece in its delivery box. It seems to me the main reason is 2 folds: firstly, the box is a bit too tall for the size of the rod; and secondly, not only box too long/tall, but it also contains no protecting stuff as the box travels to its final destination (inside is just the fishing rod, nothing else for protection or even so rod is all tight in the box, not loosely)
customer_reviews.author: DeoKeju

customer_reviews.title: Good tough rod, softer action than you'd expect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 7 foot ultralight, all the eyes are on solidly, the cork is nice feeling and the rod works ok overall. So it's an ultralight... that doesn't mean it needs to be a noodle... i was expecting a med fast action as their website lists. i'd say this is med or med slow action - soft over it's entire length. that's not always bad of course, just not what i was after this rod for, still a good lil rod.
customer_reviews.author: Savlaka

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value. Great for kayak fishing.
customer_reviews.text: As an "old-school" fisherman, I appreciate the soft feel of a good cork did butt. I've had the 6'6" med/hvy, 6'6" med and 5'0" UL for just over a month and am seriously impressed with the feel, balance, sensitivity and quality of these rods. I use monofilament on fresh water lakes and rivers for bass (kayak fishing) and these are the perfect rods for me. I feel like the price is reasonable and fit my budget well. I'm sure the tournament guys out there would argue, but the fish can't tell if they're on a $40 rod or a $200 rod. Outstanding value and quality. We will only buy Ugly Stiks from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeep Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Quite Bendy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to the amazing reviews it received. I have not had time to use it yet but it looks really nice! I bought the ultra light and was shocked by how much flexibility it had. Its going to be great for catching the 12-16in trout in Colorado. The only issue I had with buying these online was it did not show the weight on line for each length of pole. If I would have known I probably would have purchased one size up. But, I am not taking a star off for that as the pole itself is wonderful so far.
customer_reviews.author: Cloggedart

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Rod
customer_reviews.text: Wow a amazing Rod I bought 2. 7ft Medium Heavy. I do alot of Bass & Striper fishing have pulled in 3to5 lbs blk bass with No Problem. I have also caught 10lbs Striper and a lot that range from 1 to 5 lbs and the This Rods handle them with No problem. I use this stick with a Piscifun 4000 with 25 lbs jig jerking 8 strand Braided line. I also lube my top eye every fishing trip. Because braid line can kill any top eye on any rod. Just my 2 cents. Go fishing!! Oh buy the way I just purchased my third but it's a 7.6 ft. Go have fun and oil that tip.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: it's the perfect length. I'm casting about 25% further without any ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 7' ultralight for trout fishing. As long as you don't have overhead obstacles, it's the perfect length. I'm casting about 25% further without any additional effort. The 7' ul is a 2 piece and the whole tip section is crooked. Not horrible and it works, but pretty unacceptable from a manufacturing standpoint.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Very small reel seat
customer_reviews.text: Maybe there is some new standard in fishing rods that I don't know about, but the reel seat on this rod is tiny. It will not accommodate a standard foot from any reel I own. When it is screwed open all the way, it is still at least 1/8" too short to get a reel on it. I've never had this problem on any rod, ever, but perhaps something has changed? It's a beautiful rod for the money in all other respects. Had to return it and get something else; I love Huck Finn as much as the next guy, but I prefer to fish with a reel, haha.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Mccafferty

customer_reviews.title: Item defective try your luck if you want
customer_reviews.text: I received the item but it was broken in half and only received the handle and maybe a foot of the pole. Not sure what happened but this was extremely aggravating and a huge waste of time and money. Now I have to wait atlease 2 weeks to have my money refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Darling

customer_reviews.title: 5'6'' light - pieces of different length
customer_reviews.text: I love UglyStik rods, but the 5'6'' light comes in 2 pieces of different sizes. The top/thin piece is 6 or 8 inches longer than the other. It makes it difficult to transport: a) difficult to put rubber band to hold the pieces together. b) the top/thin piece is not protected by the bottom/stronger piece. I'm sending this back and I'm getting the micro series, which apparently comes in 2 pieces of same length
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Good rod for the price
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the 7-ft 2-piece medium rod. Although my first outing with this rod wasn’t quite as successful in terms of catch, I will say that I am overall pleased with the rod. I caught a good sized (18-inch) fat catfish with the rod with no problem. The rod feels solid with a good blend of strength and feel as well as comfortable. The rod is not going to match more expensive rods, but for less than 50 bucks, this is a pretty decent quality one for the casual fisherman like me. 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: JWINK

customer_reviews.title: Shipping packaging was terrible. But I love the Ugly Stik brand
customer_reviews.text: Shipping packaging was terrible. But I love the Ugly Stik brand. Bought this for the wife. Now I want one! Review on the second rod......totally in love with this thang. Hooked lots of big fish today and it handles perfectly! The packaging was much better the second time around.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco

customer_reviews.title: Shipped only half...
customer_reviews.text: This is a two piece pole. They shipped only one piece (the bottom). Like wth am I going to do with a 3 foot fishing pole...
customer_reviews.author: Tekademic

customer_reviews.title: Front eye has grooves notched in it
customer_reviews.text: Similarly to several reviews, front eye has now grooves notched in it after using the rod for surf-fishing. I am using fluorocarbon line, nothing really fancy. The rest of the rod is great. I am certainly disappointed with new design, as i have a couple of ugly stik bigwater whose eyes look much more solid. Hope the company will rectify the flaw. I can see that to be a deal breaker considering the line may snap more easily when casting.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and better then the rest
customer_reviews.text: I have had several poles over 25 years and last summer we went out and bought 2 fenwick and 2 okuma. We were up at Tom's place and we snapped both brands 4" down from the tip. Anyone who fishes knows that would be user error on a vertical lift when hooked however Ugly Stick nope. We went back to Ugly Stick elite same spot and actually bigger fish and didn't snap. I highly recommend Ugly Stick Elite or gx2.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: I Use it to Load Line Onto Reels
customer_reviews.text: I don't think it is much of a rod for actually fishing--it is toy-like. However, it is perfect for loading line onto reels. I bought a far more expensive line loader which looked like a mini-rod but it was over engineered and was impossible to use so I returned it. This makes loading line onto a reel a piece of cake. Stick your empty reel onto it, place a bit of pressure with one hand on the line at a point above the reel using a bit of cloth and wind it full with the other hand. Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: shrinkucci

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend these Ugly Stik Elites
customer_reviews.text: Used the 7 foot Medium action rods for Coho salmon fishing in Alaska. It's a thin rod for a medium action, but it is very durable, yet at the same time lets you feel all the action! I highly recommend these Ugly Stik Elites, they performed flawlessly catching over 60 coho salmon in a matter of a week.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Love Ugly Stick Elites - I now own 4 of them in different actions and lengths.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the ultra Light version of this rod first and loved it, so I went ahead and bought this Ultra Light. Its light weight and flexible with great fast action. Liked it even more so I got two more in the 7' medium fast version. I now have total of 4 UG Elites and really enjoy using them for freshwater fishing. Unlike some other reviewers I did not have any alignment or bent eyelet issues in any of my 4 rods.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I've been using GX2 and I was very happy with it, this is my 3rd US, decided to go with the Elite 7' (it was on sale) :) So far it has proven to be very light, sensitive tip and easy to handle. Currently using Shimano Stradic ci4 and it is a perfect fit.Plan on using it for live bait and lure casting, and again so far it is impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Filip

customer_reviews.title: The GX-2 is ONLY pole to buy.
customer_reviews.text: Ugly Stik GX-2s are the only fishing pole to buy. The elite is the upgraded version. Lighter and cork handle. Their biggest advantage is the one piece eyelets. No inserts to fall out. They are nearly unbreakable. You can literally tie them in a knot. I have caught some very big fish on a very light pole. Spend the money and you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Strong Yet Sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I paired my Ugly Stik Elite 7' Medium with a Pflueger President and caught plenty of Coho up in Alaska. Just a great rod that was very sensitive and landed the bigges fish I have caught to date. I didn't have a scale but it felt like 10lb and we had to remove to the head to fit that Coho in the cooler. Very comfortable fishing all day. I tend to prefer EVA but the cork grip was really comfortable and a nice size, felt good in the hand while fighting the fish. I would definitely buy it again. I used Sufix 832 15lb and it was an all around great experience with the Ugly Stik.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleViking

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Rod
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with ANY ugly stick. I have two of these in a 5 foot and two of these in a 5 foot 6 inch. I have a Zebco Omega Reel on each one, a great reel. This rod is light weigh, sturdy and very durable. I have caught bluegill, sunfish and small bass with all four, all under 5 pounds but I'm not professional, but I do love fishing. You can't go wrong with this rod in any length.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy W. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Price was AWESOME, so I had to buy it
customer_reviews.text: I got this from warehouse deals. Price was AWESOME, so I had to buy it. I've been eyeing it for a while. An ugly stick with a cork grip and high grade graphite? SIgn me up. Well so far, it is that: an ugly stick on steroids. You can buy a better rod for an extra $100, but If you can get this for $30, you'll likely not need one of them.
customer_reviews.author: EJTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday spinning rod
customer_reviews.text: Great product over the years I purchased including this order I bought 7 of these rods. it’s a great everyday rod I bought a bunch of them for my students who did not own a spinning rod. I also always keep one in the back of my truck so I can always have it so I can fish at anytime I have time. These are not rods I use in tournaments
customer_reviews.author: Bam Beydoum

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I have recently found time to start fishing after a long, work, hiatus. I own St. Croix and Loomis rods, but bought a new reel and wanted to match up a good rod with it. I spoke to a fishing buddy, who fishes tournament, and asked for his opinion, he said, try an Ugly Stik. I did, love this rod!
customer_reviews.author: Akita2

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these on my boat and have caught stripers and bluefish galore with them. I've have 3 other rods, that cost nearly 3x as much, break in the time I've had these. Wish they made them in longer lengths. They absolutely hold up when fighting a fish using 40-50lb. braid and pulling 2 hands.
customer_reviews.author: Katty Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Really nice rod! I use 2 piece for the fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice rod! I use 2 piece for the fit in my mazda6. Top piece did come slightly bent, but surprisingly I decided to overlook this and keep it. That goes to show you how much I love to get out there and fish! Would also prefer something longer, around 8.5-9.5 ft. Currently paired with a Diawa BG 3500
customer_reviews.author: Atticus Sain

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Ugly Stik can't be beat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 6'6" Ultra Light used. It came in packaged with plastic and tags looking brand new. The rod is good quality, light and very durable. I liked the Elite so much that I bought a medium 6'6" Elite. I tried the ultra sensitive all graphite expensive rods and I am done breaking the bank and my rods. I own 7 Ugly Stiks now and I dont think I will buy anything else. They just can't be beat! I put a Pflueger President on my medium for bass fishing and a Pflueger Trion on the ultra lite for pan fishing. These are great combos and I love using them.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Tip grooving after less than one year of use with mono/copolymer
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the stainless steel guides. After reading many posts on the net which reassured me that even braided line cannot groove the guides, I give this "classic indestructible rod" a try. After less than one year of use, the tip is heavily grooved. I replaced it with a Daiwa rod. I am sure the Aluminum Oxide will hold up for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Chen

customer_reviews.title: Durable! Great starter rod for kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these rods, 6’6 Medium. One for myself and one each for my son and nephew. Obviously has very high durability but you sacrifice weight. Has a decent backbone but the tip is pretty whippy. The main reason I bought Ugly Stick is because it’s a GREAT starter rod for kids. It durable, good quality, won’t break the bank and like I said it’s durable, and kids need durable.
customer_reviews.author: Terence

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rod
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for smaller fish. Trout size and smaller. Works great. Great action and fun to use. I paired it up with a 2000 size reel and really enjoy it. I paid $50 for the rod and honestly am still up in the air about whether this is a real good value or not, but I will say this, I am enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: RayJayTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive ,strong and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This rod was working really great! I just picked up fishing a few months ago. This rod was an improvement to my previous $20 walmart one. Unfortunately I was fishing on a kayak with my little dacshund and I happen to knock it over when I was adjusting her life jacket. :/ Maybe ill buy another in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: All-around great fishing poll for most any Angler
customer_reviews.text: And it's not ugly, it's really nice. I've picked up two of these over the past several years and love them. I've used these with live and artificial lures. I use Penn Battle II reels, 2500 and 3000 series with up to 10lbs test. I've never had an issue with polls breaking and the feel and sensitivity are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Best value & warranty in small rods
customer_reviews.text: Have had two rods break during my two years trout fishing beautiful South Carolina rivers. Needed a trustworthy solution and found that in the Ugly Stik with its added graphite and seven (7) year warranty. Perfect size for the tight rivers, plenty of whip-action, comfortable cork handle.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good backbone but I didn't like the very soft tip ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent rod. Good backbone but I didn't like the very soft tip action. Thus only 4 stars. I bought the seven foot medium two piece. It's rated for 6 to 14 lb test 1/4 to 5/8 Oz lures. I'm going to use it for crappie,maybe drop-shotting
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G Boevingloh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little rod
customer_reviews.text: The feel on this reel is incredible. Cant beat the price and as with all ugly stiks, it's nearly impossible to break. Caught hundreds of trout on it as well as bass with no issues. Perfect amount of flex and back bone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reel seat too small to hole a 5000 size spinning reel
customer_reviews.text: Pole is excellent quality however, the reel seat is not large enough to accommodate my Penn Conflict II 5000 size. I purchased the pole specifically for this reel. How can you have a 7'6" pole that can handle 17lb line not be able to hold a 5000 size reel. Bad design Shakespeare. Not happy. Had to put my 4000 size Battle II on it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Romano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I own a ton of high end fishing products, and I resort back to these rods frequently because I don’t wanna cry why my son or friends break or lose them. They work great, look great, feel great, and are durable and most importantly, don’t cost an arm and a leg for a rod.
customer_reviews.author: Blake D.

customer_reviews.title: It Ain't Ugy, it's Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: This rod is exactly what I expected. The Shakespeare name still means quality if this rod is any example. Holds my Diawa 4000 spinning reel very well and I look forward to many happy hours of casting, and catching, with this rod.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur fishermen, but I know bad quality when I see it. Box was damaged upon delivery, the pole was slightly crooked because the eyes did not line up. Handle was loose and did not feel stable. Overall disappointed, especially after hearing and seeing so many positive reviews. Tip: unless it's an official fishing site don't get poles from online or Amazon, go in-store to get a feel for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kesuma

customer_reviews.title: A high performer, as expected! Typical Ugly Stik
customer_reviews.text: As one would expect with Ugly Stik, this rod can handle its business! I love it. I’ve caught about 40 fish on this ranging from sunfish to bass to small pike and it performs great. It’s not quite as light as my other new ultra light but it’s not noticeable to me unless I go from the other one directly to this one immediately.
customer_reviews.author: CNY Dave

customer_reviews.title: Rod quality is poor
customer_reviews.text: Got this stick two weeks ago, finally used it yesterday. When casting, the stick broke. I was only using 2 oz. sinker. First and last time to buy this product. Better off buying from Walmart, the Shakespeare tiger for less. Been using it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Usabarashi

customer_reviews.title: I thought the 1 Star reviews were a joke!
customer_reviews.text: Like many others said I only received half a rod. Which does in fact make it ultra light weight. But half a rod has zero flexibility and is very expensive! But please do not waste your money like I did. I’ve now been on hold for over 30 minutes with their customer support which just took me to Shakespeares 1800 number.
customer_reviews.author: Israel maleck

customer_reviews.title: What's wrong with your rod?
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these rods but this is the first one I bought online and not from the store where I could inspect the rod. I took a gamble since the price was good, knowing they often have some crooked rods in the mix at the tackle stores. I typically pick through them to find a good one. This one came crooked. Real crooked. Tried to show it in the pictures but they didn't do it justice.
customer_reviews.author: Afugazifan

customer_reviews.title: Received it broken and cracked.
customer_reviews.text: The pole is great but was delivered with the top foot of the pole cracked and broken. Make sure you test it with someone holding onto the tip and bend it, to see if it's cracked. The sent me a new one right away so we'll see about the next one. Other than that it's a beauty of a pole and has very durable eyes on it. Lightweight with plenty of action but still stout too. Great looking and feeling pole. Gotta love ugly sticks. Anxious to get my new one ao I can catch some winter steelhead!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Huserik

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod but packaging sucked
customer_reviews.text: Great product really nice to fish with a newer style. Only used it 3 times but good rod. However when it was delivered the bottom eye was poking out the side. When they packed it thejust threw it in and never put anything around it to keep it centered. next time I’ll just go to Walmart where it’s cheaper and not bugged up.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Roy

customer_reviews.title: A brand-name good quality real fit loose. Unable to tighten
customer_reviews.text: I installed a top brand name good quality spinning reel on this pole and was very disappointed with how loose it is. I will have to shim the pole in order to get it to tighten down. The previous pole that this reel was installed on tightened the reel down properly. A person can definitely see the inferior quality of this days manufacturing compared to two decades ago..Shakespeare was a top brand name but no more! Sad
customer_reviews.author: Cautious Buyer

customer_reviews.title: ugly stik resurrection!
customer_reviews.text: i was so depressed that the ugly stiks were not the same as the older ones,but then i saw the "ELITE" series with the cork handle. i didnt wanna get my hopes up but couldnt wait. i am very impressed with this model and i feel back to normal with it. it cost $10 more than the gx2 but i think its worth it. true ugly stik enthusiasts will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: gregory

customer_reviews.title: For a boy that loves to fish, from an old man that see,s his need an what’s to help !
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for an 9 year old boy , that loves to fish, I bought a reel and fishing bag with 4 trays I filled 3 trays with new tackle and gave it to him. I know his first name and where he lives that is all I know. The boy needs a little TLC from some one who cares.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great Pole
customer_reviews.text: This was quick but to do some light fresh water fishing around my house. The quality feels good and sturdy for the price. I had no issues casting or reeling anything on the line. I would recommend this if you’re looking for a quick fishing pole
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Alswais

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for trout with bobber
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this rod. we go for trout and carch the limit most of the times. she uses a bobber. I thing its going to be too stiff for another as you will not see the top bend enought when the fish is taking the lure
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Triboi

customer_reviews.title: BEST ALL ROUND POLE FOR MULTIPLE SPECIES.
customer_reviews.text: I have paired this rod with BG 3500. It is a perfect combo for Redfish, Trout, and bass. I use it for everything and has no problem with bull Reds. Why spend more it works great with artificials and live bait too. I can detect bites really easy
customer_reviews.author: FISHFEARME

customer_reviews.title: two pieces not equal length
customer_reviews.text: ups, nice rod. should work fine. downs, I got a 5'6" 2 piece rod thinking both pieces would be equal length. they are not. the handle portion is about 18" long and the forward piece about 4' long. so the disassembled package is about 4'. not the best for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rehfeld

customer_reviews.title: Now for the fish to bite
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Elite. Have several older casting and spinning rods. I tried this 5’ ultra lite Elite. I have to say I’m happy so far. It casts 1/8 oz road runner lures like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rod at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love these Ugly Stiks , very well made and looks great too especially the cork handles. However the mailman left me a note stating the package was “too big to fit in the mail truck”...so I had to go to the post office and pick it up... well worth the trip!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Ugly Stick has always been good
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great rod for the price. Been around for decades because of its consistent quality. I did notice however the two-piece version of this rod is nowhere near as stiff as the one piece.
customer_reviews.author: John Dunn

customer_reviews.title: The rods are pretty good. I bought the two piece for travel ...
customer_reviews.text: The rods are pretty good. I bought the two piece for travel purposes. If I wasn't traveling, I probably would have bought the single piece. Mostly ascetics. Nice feeling rods. They have good sensitivity and enough backbone to set the hook on perch and bluegill.
customer_reviews.author: RGJ

customer_reviews.title: Rod was received broken in the package
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely dissapointed, shipped the item to Jamaica only to open the sealed package and find the rod broken in 2. Tried to attache picture of the item as received
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superior product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many uglies and this one is my favorite. I prefer this one to my old fenwick which was 3x the price. The cork is delightful and the rod guides are perfect for using braided line. Ugly sticks are nearly indestructible and now they added the creature comforts to that mix. Well done!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever...
customer_reviews.text: I've been an Ugly Stik customer/user for the last 30+ years, and still have/use my very first one. I look for quality in products and not just name brands, but I've obviously become a Ugly Stick "name" fan. They earned it!
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was hoping for in a Snook /Redfish rod and I've loved Uglystick for some time now. Perfect 8 - 15 lb rig with the Penn Battle II I paired with it.
customer_reviews.author: ProLine 21

customer_reviews.title: Best Pole I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: Caught about 30 trout on it the last few weeks. The flexible tip and 7' length really gets the lure out there. The only thing I use my second pole for is throwing 1/2oz spinners with no weight, the more light weight rods seem to throw those further.
customer_reviews.author: Taupe

customer_reviews.title: What happened?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend. He caught a 34lb. catfish the first time he used it and it broke the rod! He got the fish but it's an Ugly Stik! It's not supposed to break!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: Not my first Ugly Stik and won't be my last. I like the rods and they seem to hold up well to abuse in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Just your average guy

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Product as described and good price. Very durable and sensitive, this rod used in the salt water environment with care will last a very long time
customer_reviews.author: Debra Simmers

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: First one shipped with a broken eye, replacement came next day. First time I had the rod out it handled a 27in red no problem paired with a penn pursuit III 2500 series. Strong enough for reds, sensitive enough for sheepshead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This rod is perfect for small jig and flys
customer_reviews.text: This rod is perfect for small jig and flys. I use 4 lbs Stern line. I can feel it on the bottom and when i jig , it smooth and the way it bents it's amazing. Perfect Ultra light.
customer_reviews.author: GMC89PACH

customer_reviews.title: Get it ! Good rod!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money and sensitivity is awesome ! Ugly sticks never let me down just wish the guides were better smoother quality but it’s not a deal breaker and I have 2 of these
customer_reviews.author: John71

customer_reviews.title: Good trout rod
customer_reviews.text: This rod is sort of the go-to rod when you don't want to spend a ton of money but want a solid, task specific rod. I bought one for trout.
customer_reviews.author: mjsjr

customer_reviews.title: Best Walleye fishing rod you can own for the price, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these rods a while ago, and decided to get another one since I am head over heels in love with it so now I have 2
customer_reviews.author: Timcat10

customer_reviews.title: Nice durable rods.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I have bought of this brand, other two for bait casters. Love these rods will replace my three other poles with these soon. Cant go wrong with the ugly stick!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but if in doubt go for the heavier power option.
customer_reviews.text: Serviceable rod at a good price point. I bought the medium power 7' option to pair with an Okuma Avenger ABF 4000 reel for medium duty bottom fishing and frankly it is a bit too light. I should have gone with at the medium heavy power. Like all Ugly Stik rods, the tip on this rod is pretty soft.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal. Love these rods
customer_reviews.text: Awesome deal. Love these rods. Very lightweight. I use it for all kinds of fish. Specifically Salmon in Alaska. Works great to haul in some solid 8lb fish.
customer_reviews.author: J White

customer_reviews.title: Not very sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: For a rod that's listed for 10 dollars more than my other main rod, it's not nearly as sensitive. I can feel everything with my other 6'6" rod. This one kind of feels like listening to music with ear muffs on.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Bent blank. Dont panic!
customer_reviews.text: Don't panic and immediately request a return! If your rods blank (section) seems to be bent, if you put on line and sink and/or lure the blank will straighten out. The blank only appears to be bent because of how thin the tip is, the rod I received had a curve in the tip to the right, but after I lined it and attached a lure the tip was normal. Long story short, don't eye ball the rod itself without it being fully set up as they will ALL appear to be bent!
customer_reviews.author: Keagan Coss

customer_reviews.title: Pretty tough rod.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 15lb air compressor repeatedly roll over it in the back of my truck for at least several hundred miles and all it did was bent the eyes. I straightened the eyes back out and it works good as new again.
customer_reviews.author: Hillbilly4life

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod, seems durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4YO as his first rod, along with an under spin reel. He loves it. Seems durable, and I bought the smallest size for him to handle. Looks like it will last for years
customer_reviews.author: Scot W

customer_reviews.title: Ugly and loving it
customer_reviews.text: Love this fishing rod. I caught my biggest trout to date on this 6' 6" ultra light 2 piece pole. This pole casts much longer than my other poles. The light action keeps that hook buried in the fish's mouth! I would highly recommend this pole.
customer_reviews.author: SC Smith

customer_reviews.title: Loving my new rod  will be a great combo with my new reel
customer_reviews.text: Love the lightweight, the balance....this should be a perfect set up for feeling the Walleye Bite!!
customer_reviews.author: Roger of Arizona

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the Rod and am sure it will work ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod for my wife, we are doing a fly in fishing trip in Ontario Canada and I wanted something two pc. that would hold up to large Brook trout. I am happy with the Rod and am sure it will work out well. For the price the quality seems pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Backtrackjack

customer_reviews.title: I think the description needs to define this better. I will find a use for it
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I misread but this rod is lighter and smaller than I expected. It is a quality rod but I cant imagine it being sufficient for any saltwater fishing, except perhaps to catch bait. The reel holder also is only for very small reels. It is however of high quality and if you are looking for something for small trout this would work well. I think the description needs to define this better. I will find a use for it, but I went to Walmart and got an Ugly Stick Inshore Select in 7ft which is perfect to go with my Penn SpinFisher 4500 or 5500, and only $49 at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Alarider

customer_reviews.title: Great budget rods
customer_reviews.text: Been fishing these all my life. I've caught bass, sunfish and catfish on a single rod all in the course of 3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: Came broken!
customer_reviews.text: Came broken. Who ever packaged this strapped it tip off to make it fit in the box impressive as these poles are hard the break but incredibly Anoying who gas the time for this kind of crap? Ban this seller.
customer_reviews.author: ej

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Good rod, decent price, about the best you can get for your money, if you're looking to not break the bank, but still do some serious fishing
customer_reviews.author: B. Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Durable and tough with a bit of refinement over the entry level versions
customer_reviews.text: Great rods for the, not the lightest or most sensitive, but if you're looking for a budget friendly rod that will hold up very well this is probably the best option around this price range. I a use a 2 piece as my "trunk rod" because they're so durable.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Unbreakable and made to use a lot , unlike my more expensive rods that seem to last a year or two at most then break or the eyelets fall out, etc
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Reader

customer_reviews.title: I own more expensive rods, but this is quality
customer_reviews.text: Best money I ever spent on a rod. The flex of this medium 7’6” is perfect for surf fishing, I’ve caught 20” fish and even small sharks.
customer_reviews.author: Luckycraftdave

customer_reviews.title: distance with minimum effort
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a Christmas gift, but used it myself a couple of times. This is a nice rod, it has a very nice whip to it to get the bait out at a good distance with minimum effort. Very thin and light rod with great action for inshore fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Picayune

customer_reviews.title: Reel Seat is too small
customer_reviews.text: The reel seat is too small and cannot fit even a very small spinning reel. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Need QUALITY CONTROL !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unqualified product. The rod is crooked right out of the box. I have to do a return NOTE: the reel seat is small not fit on penn reel 5000 up
customer_reviews.author: Tram Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $ over regular Ugly Stick
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pole, yes it is worth the extra money over the regular Ugly Sticks. Slightly fatter grip, Busch more sensitive rod.
customer_reviews.author: Jamus D.

customer_reviews.title: Good fishing rod
customer_reviews.text: Picked up 2 of these rod's and they handle great. I bought a new spinning reel for one of them and it fit perfect. Glad I went with these over buying a cheap rod and reel combo set.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a Sharky III 3000 baitfeeder to use bottom fishing for up to 10 lb game and it is a nice setup. Have caught plenty of catfish and perch on it but they were small game size
customer_reviews.author: Edward Battle III

product_meta.title: Ugly Stik Elite Spinning Fishing Rod
feature_bullets: Ugly Tech Construction with added graphite for lighter weight and increased sensitivity
Ugly Tuff one piece stainless steel guides provide maximum durability
Cork handles provide comfort during lengthy fishing outings

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
